clues.text: Built to commemorate the defeat of the Tatars, St. Basil's Cathedral is in this capital city
In ancient Rome it was a temple to 12 gods; in the 600s it became a church to just one, holding the remains of martyrs
In 2023 16th St. Baptist in this city marks 150 years of  the congregation, a history marred by a 1963 bombing
Climbing up on Montmartre Hill, I could see Paris' city lights & this basilica whose name means sacred heart
Controlled by the Palestinian Authority, the Church of this is believed to mark the birthplace of Jesus in Bethlehem
About half the size of Earth, it has a 24.6-hour day
For 20 years in every 248, it's further from the Sun than Pluto
It was the first planet explored by a spacecraft, 1962's Mariner 2
Leda is one of its more than 50 named moons

It's surrounded by phenomena named
A, B, C, D, E, F & G
Born in Boston in 1890, she had 9 children, including John, Robert, Edward & Eunice
In 1986 she won an Emmy award for playing Rose Nylund on "The Golden Girls"
After appearing in the "Ziegfeld Follies", she starred in "Star and Garter"

Don't act too high & mighty in Mexico or you might be called a "fresa", which literally translates to this fruit

Ordinal name for the commoners who turned into a revolutionary national assembly in 1789 France

Of 1/4, 1/2, or 3/4, amount of alloy in 18 karat gold

President & place where he said, "The world will little note nor long remember what we say here"

rounds.text: This state, whose flag features a bison, also has a town founded by & named for Buffalo Bill
